item.title: [TUT]How to use Ruler's XML Auth
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

The Un-Named:

I don’t think it’s possible unless it bruteforces every possible file on the website and tries to lag it’s self so it treats the file as a download. I’ve downloaded a few .php scripts from websites before when I was lagging bad.

I get that on FF too, but that is only when you disconnect and reconnect. I don’t think you can actually get the source php file.

item.title: [TUT]How to use Ruler's XML Auth
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“jan274, post:23, topic:53129”]I got an error and i did what you said.

[code]
Adding 123

Warning: fopen(the renamed xml.xml) [function.fopen]: failed to open stream: Permission denied in /home//public_html/adminknight(renamed).php on line 187
ERROR: could not open XML output[/code][/quote]

You need to make sure your files are set to 777 in permissions(search google for “file permissions” and read your hosts FAQ). I’ve never ran into this problem before and I don’t know what webhost your using so I can’t help you.

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT]How to use Ruler's XML Auth

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:19, topic:53129”]That would be server problems, not simply lag from you.

The server should never serve up the code for a php file, ever. Unless something breaks.[/quote]

I thought that too. It’s happened once on mopar for the index.php script, and a few times on imageshack witch is ridiculously slow for me.

item.title: [TUT]How to use Ruler's XML Auth
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Xx Abyssal xX, post:12, topic:53129”]Alright so it’s working nice and dandy <3, but I’ve got a question.

On the adminknight page, where you can edit all of the users, how the heck can I make it so people don’t go onto that file and tamper with my users?[/quote]

Give it a ridiculously hard name to guess, like I did in the tutorial: “Ok, now, moving on, rename adminknight.php to something random, I’ll name mine to 533jjss.php”.

You should add hard names for everything or find a php script that requires a login for each file view except for the index.php one.

[quote=“wyn10, post:13, topic:53129”]for me it just goes to freehosta’s hompage

ideas?[/quote]

It’s a recent Freehostia problem(intended in my opinion), it happens on a lot of files on a lot of websites there, try using AwardSpace.

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT]How to use Ruler's XML Auth
item.dc:creator: @ejjman1 ejjman1
item.description:
@ejjman1 wrote:

[quote=“Infintry001, post:5, topic:53129”]I get a socket error:

Socket Error # 11004

What is this? Did i do something wrong?[/quote]

I get that every now and then, you must be connected to the internet, and when it asks if it can access a file and/or the internet, you must hit yes; I’d hit always. That is probably your problem…

Never got to thank you for this dude. It helped lots. Free 2 Mil for my script

Read full topic
